verses.verse: Then answered <S%H6030><s%> Bildad <S%H1085><s%> the Shuhite <S%H7747><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>,
How <S%H575><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> wilt thou speak <S%H4448><s%> these things <S%H561><s%>? And how long shall the words of thy mouth <S%H6310><s%> be like a mighty <S%H3524><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%>?
Doth God <S%H410><s%> pervert <S%H5791><s%> justice <S%H4941><s%>? Or doth the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> pervert <S%H5791><s%> righteousness <S%H6664><s%>?
If thy children <S%H1121><s%> have sinned <S%H2398><s%> against him <S%H7971><s%>, And he hath delivered them into the hand of <S%H3027><s%> their transgression <S%H6588><s%>;
If thou wouldest seek <S%H7836><s%> diligently <S%H7836><s%> unto God <S%H410><s%>, And make thy supplication <S%H2603><s%> to the Almighty <S%H7706><s%>;

If thou wert pure <S%H2134><s%> and upright <S%H3477><s%>: Surely now he would awake <S%H5782><s%> for thee <S%H5116><s%>, And make the habitation of thy righteousness <S%H6664><s%> prosperous <S%H7999><s%>.
And though thy beginning <S%H7225><s%> was small <S%H4705><s%>, Yet thy latter end <S%H319><s%> would greatly <S%H3966><s%> increase <S%H7685><s%>.
For inquire <S%H7592><s%>, I pray thee <S%H7223><s%>, of the former age <S%H1755><s%>, And apply <S%H3559><s%> thyself to that which their fathers <S%H1><s%> have searched out <S%H2714><s%>:
(For we are but of yesterday <S%H8543><s%>, and know <S%H3045><s%> nothing <S%H3117><s%>, Because our days upon earth <S%H776><s%> are a shadow <S%H6738><s%>);
Shall not they teach <S%H3384><s%> thee <S%H559><s%>, and tell thee <S%H3318><s%>, And utter words <S%H4405><s%> out of their heart <S%H3820><s%>?
Can the rush <S%H1573><s%> grow up <S%H1342><s%> without mire <S%H1207><s%>? Can <S%H7685><s%> the flag <S%H260><s%> grow <S%H7685><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> water <S%H4325><s%>?
Whilst it is yet in its greenness <S%H3><s%>, and not cut down <S%H6998><s%>, It withereth <S%H3001><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> any other herb <S%H2682><s%>.
So are the paths <S%H734><s%> of all that forget <S%H7911><s%> God <S%H410><s%>; And the hope <S%H8615><s%> of the godless <S%H2611><s%> man shall perish <S%H6><s%>:
Whose confidence <S%H3689><s%> shall break in sunder <S%H6990><s%>, And whose trust <S%H4009><s%> is a spider <S%H5908><s%>'s web <S%H1004><s%>.
He shall lean <S%H8172><s%> upon his house <S%H1004><s%>, but it shall not stand <S%H5975><s%>: He shall hold <S%H2388><s%> fast thereby <S%H6965><s%>, but it shall not endure.
He is green <S%H7373><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%>, And his shoots <S%H3127><s%> go forth <S%H3318><s%> over his garden <S%H1593><s%>.
His roots <S%H8328><s%> are wrapped about <S%H5440><s%> the stone <S%H1530><s%> -heap, He beholdeth <S%H2372><s%> the place <S%H1004><s%> of stones <S%H68><s%>.
If he be destroyed <S%H1104><s%> from his place <S%H4725><s%>, Then it shall deny <S%H3584><s%> him <S%H7200><s%>, saying, I have not seen thee.
Behold <S%H4885><s%>, this is the joy of his way <S%H1870><s%>; And out of the earth <S%H6083><s%> shall others <S%H312><s%> spring <S%H6779><s%>.
Behold <S%H410><s%>, God will not cast away <S%H3988><s%> a perfect <S%H8535><s%> man <S%H2388><s%>, Neither will he uphold the evil-doers <S%H7489><s%>.
He will yet fill <S%H4390><s%> thy mouth <S%H6310><s%> with laughter <S%H7814><s%>, And thy lips <S%H8193><s%> with shouting <S%H8643><s%>.
They that hate <S%H8130><s%> thee shall be clothed <S%H3847><s%> with shame <S%H1322><s%>; And the tent <S%H168><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> shall be no more <S%H369><s%>.
